messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] old leather tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Rich; Look like a later Edo tsuba.  The swelling may be from moisture getting under the lacquer and into the leather. John ... From: Richard Turner To:
messages.messageBody:
Hi Rich;

Look like a later Edo tsuba. The swelling may be from moisture getting under the lacquer and into the leather.

John
----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, August 22, 2003 6:35 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] old leather tsuba


Hi all, we were talking about these a while back but I didnt think this one looked so old, I may be wrong, it also looks swealled or something onone side. Ilike the Mon on it though. Opinions.

Rich

http://tinyurl.com/kwtk

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] old leather tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Rich, I think you re right.  It looks like one of the later Edo period examples.  It does appear to have some condition problems. Jim Hi all, we were talking
messages.messageBody:
Rich,
I think you're right. It looks like one of the later Edo period examples. It does appear to have some condition problems.

Jim



Hi all, we were talking about these a while back but I didnt think this one looked so old, I may be wrong, it also looks swealled or something onone side. Ilike the Mon on it though. Opinions.

Rich
